de.esoco.lib.reflect

Class ReflectUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.reflect.ReflectUtil

  • public final class ReflectUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static utility methods for reflection.

    • Method Detail

      • assertConstantDeclarations

        public static <T> boolean assertConstantDeclarations(java.lang.Class<?> rDeclaringClass,
                                                     java.lang.Class<? super T> rConstantClass,
                                                     java.lang.String sNameMethod,
                                                     boolean bAllAccessModifiers)
        This is a helper method to implement the assertion of the correct field names for constant declarations in an enumeration pattern. This method will iterate through the final static fields (i.e. constants) of a certain class that are instances of a certain base class and checks whether the field names are equal to the internal name strings of the instance. To access the name strings the constant class must provide a public no-argument method with the given name.

        This method will not check the superclasses of the declaring class. The names of the constants may include namespaces which will be ignored in the name comparisons.

        This method is intended to be used at development time and therefore uses assertions to perform it's checks. It returns a boolean value which will always be TRUE so that it can be invoked in an assert statement (which is the recommended way to use it). By doing so the constant assertions will only be performed if assertions are enabled and not in production code. A typical invocation should be done in a static initialization block after the constant declarations and would look like this:

        assert ReflectUtil.assertConstantDeclarations(AppConstants.class, TestEnum.class, "getName", false);
        Parameters:
        rDeclaringClass - The class to check the declared fields of
        rConstantClass - The (base) class of the constants to check
        sNameMethod - The method to query the constant names with
        bAllAccessModifiers - TRUE to check constants with all access modifiers, FALSE for public constants only
        Returns:
        Always TRUE

      • checkAccessible

        public static <T extends java.lang.reflect.Member> T checkAccessible(T rMember)
        Checks whether a class member is publicly accessible. If not the method AccessibleObject.setAccessible(boolean) will be invoked on it to make it accessible.
        Parameters:
        rMember - The member to check
        Returns:
        The input member to allow call concatenation

      • collectConstants

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> collectConstants(java.lang.Class<?> rDeclaringClass,
                                                     java.lang.Class<? super T> rConstantClass,
                                                     java.lang.String sCheckNameMethod,
                                                     boolean bAllAccessModifiers,
                                                     boolean bWithSuperclasses,
                                                     boolean bAllowNamespace)
        Collects all constants of a certain type from a declaring class and returns them in a list. The constants must be declared as public static final and must not be NULL. Non-public fields will be ignored and the static final modifiers will be checked with assertions so that errors can be detected at development time. If a constant is NULL or an exception occurs during the reflective access to a field an AssertionError will be thrown. Because of these checks no fields of the constant type must exist that are not static final and/or are NULL.

        Because constants are often used with a name field that must match the name of the constant instance this method provides a way to assert the equality of the constant name and the name field. To compare the names with an assertion the third argument must be the name of a public no-argument method that returns the value of the name field (e.g. "getName"). To omit this check it must be NULL.

        This method is intended to be used during the initialization of classes that want to keep a list of their declared constants, and should not be used in instance methods. Therefore using assertions to signal uncritical errors is sufficient. If a class needs to verify the constants only without the need to access a list of them it can use the method assertConstantDeclarations(Class, Class, String, boolean) instead.

        Parameters:
        rDeclaringClass - The class that declares the constants to collect
        rConstantClass - The datatype (super)class of the constants (relaxed to '? super T' to prevent conversion conflicts with generic types)
        sCheckNameMethod - The name of the method to check the instance names with or NULL to omit this check
        bAllAccessModifiers - TRUE to check constants with all access modifiers, FALSE for public constants only
        bWithSuperclasses - TRUE to collect all fields, including that of superclasses; FALSE to collect the fields of the given declaring class only
        bAllowNamespace - TRUE to allow the instance names to begin with a namespace string, separated by the '.' char
        Returns:
        A list of all constants of the given base type that are declared in the declaring class

      • findAnyPublicMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findAnyPublicMethod(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                                           java.lang.String sMethod)
        Tries to find an arbitrary public method with a certain name in the given class. Returns the first method (in the classes' declaration order) with the given name or NULL if no such method exists.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class in which to search for the method
        sMethod - The name of the public method to search for
        Returns:
        The corresponding method instance or NULL if none could be found

      • findMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethod(java.util.Collection<java.lang.reflect.Method> rMethods,
                                                  java.lang.Class<?>... rArgTypes)
        Tries to find a matching method with certain parameters in a list of methods. The method collection argument will be searched for methods that have a parameter list that is capable of accepting arguments of the types contained in the rArgTypes argument. That means that each parameter of a matching method must be of a type that is either the same as, or is a supertype of the corresponding type in the rArgTypes array.

        If the rArgTypes array contains NULL values these will be considered as matching any parameter type at the same position. The application is then responsible of providing the correct argument value (i.e. NULL or of a type matching the method's parameter) on method invocation.

        This method will not distinguish between multiple variants of the method with compatible parameter lists. It will choose and return the first compatible method that can be found in the collection argument.

        Parameters:
        rMethods - A collection containing the methods to search
        rArgTypes - An array containing the classes of the argument types (may either be NULL, NO_ARGS, or empty for no-argument methods)
        Returns:
        The corresponding method instance or NULL if none could be found

      • findMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethod(java.lang.reflect.Method[] rMethods,
                                                  java.lang.Class<?>... rArgTypes)
        A variant of findMethod(Collection, Class...) for method arrays.
        See Also:
        findMethod(Collection, Class...)

      • findMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethod(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                                  java.lang.String sMethod,
                                                  java.lang.Class<?>... rArgTypes)
        Tries to find a method with a certain name in the complete hierarchy of the given class. Determines all declared methods with the given name with getDeclaredMethods() and uses getMethod() to select a method with a matching parameter list.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class from which to return the method
        sMethod - The name of the method to search for
        rArgTypes - An array containing the classes of the argument types (may either be NULL, NO_ARGS, or empty for no-argument methods)
        Returns:
        The corresponding method instance or NULL if none could be found

      • findPublicMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findPublicMethod(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                                        java.lang.String sMethod,
                                                        java.lang.Class<?>... rArgTypes)
        Tries to find a public method with a certain name and parameter types in the given class. Determines all public methods with the given name through getPublicMethods() and uses getMethod() to select a method with a matching parameter list.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class from which to return the method
        sMethod - The name of the public method to search for
        rArgTypes - An array containing the classes of the argument types (may either be NULL, NO_ARGS, or empty for no-argument methods)
        Returns:
        The corresponding method instance or NULL if none could be found

      • forceInit

        public static void forceInit(java.lang.Class<?> rClass)
        Forces the initialization of a certain class. Starting with Java 5 classes that are referred to with class literals are not automatically initialized (see http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/compatibility.html). This method can be invoked to ensure that a class is initialized.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to force the initialization of

      • getAllFields

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> getAllFields(java.lang.Class<?> rClass)
        Returns a list of all fields in a class hierarchy. This includes all fields of the given class and all it's superclasses (but not any interfaces) with any access modifier.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to return the fields of
        Returns:
        A list containing the fields (may be empty but will never be NULL)

      • getAllMethods

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Method> getAllMethods(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                                                     java.lang.String sMethodName)
        Returns all declared methods of a class that have a certain name. Only the name will be checked, the parameter lists of the methods will be ignored.

        Attention: Currently only the direct hierarchy of classes will be considered by this method. Any interfaces declared by classes in the hierarchy will be ignored.

        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to get the methods from
        sMethodName - The method name to search for
        Returns:
        A new list containing all methods with the given in name in the argument class; will be empty if no matching methods could be found

      • getArgumentTypes

        public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getArgumentTypes(java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
        Returns an array containing the argument types of an array of argument values. If a value is NULL the type in the result array will also be NULL.
        Parameters:
        rArgs - The argument values (may be NULL)
        Returns:
        An array of the argument type classes; will be the constant NO_ARGS for no arguments

      • getArgumentTypes

        public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getArgumentTypes(java.lang.Object[] rArgs,
                                                    boolean bUsePrimitives)
        Returns an array containing the argument types of an array of argument values. If a value is NULL the type in the result array will also be NULL. If bUseNativeTypes is TRUE any type class that has a corresponding native type will be replaced with the latter one (e.g. Integer.class becomes int.class).
        Parameters:
        rArgs - The argument values (may be NULL)
        bUsePrimitives - TRUE to convert type classes to the corresponding primitive types
        Returns:
        An array of the argument type classes; will be the constant NO_ARGS for no arguments

      • getCallerClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getCallerClass(boolean bDifferentClass)
        Returns the class that called the caller of this method.
        Parameters:
        bDifferentClass - TRUE if the first different caller class should be returned
        Returns:
        The class of the caller of the calling method
        See Also:
        getCallerClassName(boolean)

      • getCallerClassName

        public static java.lang.String getCallerClassName(boolean bDifferentClass)
        Returns the name of the class that called the caller of this method The boolean parameter controls whether the calling class of the calling method will be returned or if the first different class will be returned. The latter will make a difference if the calling method had been called from another method in it's own class. In that case a value of TRUE will cause the first different class to be returned, indepent from the call chain in the class that called this method.
        Parameters:
        bDifferentClass - TRUE if the name of the first different caller class should be returned
        Returns:
        The name of the class of the caller of the calling method

      • getClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getClass(java.lang.String sClassName)
        Returns the Class object for a certain class name or NULL if no class could be found. This method can be used alternatively instead of the Class.forName(String) method in cases where a NULL check is more appropriate than a try-catch block.
        Parameters:
        sClassName - The name of the class to return
        Returns:
        The corresponding class object or NULL for none

      • getField

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                               java.lang.String sFieldName)
        Tries to find a certain field in a class hierarchy. This includes all declared fields of the given class and all it's superclasses (but not any interfaces).
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to search the field in
        sFieldName - The name of the field to return
        Returns:
        The matching field instance or NULL if no matching field could be found

      • getFieldValue

        public static java.lang.Object getFieldValue(java.lang.String sFieldName,
                                             java.lang.Object rObject)
        Returns the value of a particular field in an object. The actual field is determined by means of the getField(Class, String) method. Then the method getFieldValue(Field, Object) will invoked and it's result returned.
        Parameters:
        sFieldName - The name of the field to return the value of
        rObject - The object to read the field value from
        Returns:
        The value of the given field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the field doesn't exist or accessing the field value fails

      • getFieldValue

        public static java.lang.Object getFieldValue(java.lang.reflect.Field rField,
                                             java.lang.Object rObject)
        Returns the value of a particular field in an object. If the field or it's class is not public this method will try to make it accessible by invoking AccessibleObject.setAccessible(boolean) on it. This requires that the caller's context has sufficient rights to do so, else a SecurityException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        rField - The field to return the value of
        rObject - The object to read the field value from
        Returns:
        The value of the given field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the field doesn't exist or accessing the field value fails

      • getImplementationClass

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<? extends T> getImplementationClass(java.lang.Class<T> rClass)
        Returns a standard implementation class for an abstract class or an interface. If the given class neither represents an interface nor an abstract class it will be returned unchanged. Otherwise an implementation class will be returned if it had been registered previously. Several standard mappings (e.g. for collection classes) are registered automatically, others can be registered by the application. This can be done with the registerImplementation(Class, Class) method.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to return the implementation for
        Returns:
        The implementation for the given class or NULL if no mapping exists

      • getNamespace

        public static java.lang.String getNamespace(java.lang.String sTypeName)
        Returns the name of the namespace of a certain class or package. If the argument is an inner class this method will return the name of the enclosing class. Otherwise it returns the name of the enclosing (parent) package.
        Parameters:
        sTypeName - The name of the class or package to determine the parent package of
        Returns:
        The namespace of the type or NULL if the name denotes a top-level element
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the argument is NULL

      • getPrimitiveType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getPrimitiveType(java.lang.Class<?> rWrapperClass)
        Returns the corresponding primitive type class (e.g. int.class, char.class) for a certain wrapper class (Integer.class, Character.class).
        Parameters:
        rWrapperClass - The class to return the corresponding primitive type for
        Returns:
        The corresponding primitive type or NULL if the argument is not an instance of a wrapper class

      • getPublicConstructor

        public static <T> java.lang.reflect.Constructor<T> getPublicConstructor(java.lang.Class<T> rClass,
                                                                        java.lang.Class<?>... rArgTypes)
        Returns the public constructor of a class with the given argument types. If a checked exception occurs it will be mapped to a runtime exception.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to return the constructor of
        rArgTypes - The classes of the argument types
        Returns:
        The public constructor

      • getPublicMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method getPublicMethod(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                                       java.lang.String sMethod,
                                                       java.lang.Object[] rArgs,
                                                       java.lang.Class<?>[] rArgTypes)
        Returns a public method with a certain name and parameters. This implementation is based on the Class.getMethod(String, Class[]) method and therefore must be invoked with either the exactly matching argument types from the method signature or with argument values that have exactly these types. Else the method will not be found by the Class method. In such cases, the method findPublicMethod(Class, String, Class[]) can be used instead because it considers the class hierarchy of method parameters.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class from which to return the method
        sMethod - The name of the public method to search for
        rArgs - The arguments of the method call (NULL for none)
        rArgTypes - The classes of the argument types or NULL if they shall be determined from the argument values (only possible if these are not NULL and have the exact types)
        Returns:
        The corresponding method instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no matching method could be found or if the invocation fails

      • getPublicMethods

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Method> getPublicMethods(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                                                        java.lang.String sMethodName)
        Returns all public methods with the given name from the argument class. The method arguments are ignored, only the method names are compared. That means if multiple overloaded methods with the same name exist all of them will be returned. When invoking one of the returned method the caller must make sure to use the correct count and type of parameters.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to search the method in
        sMethodName - The method name to search for
        Returns:
        A new list containing the matching public methods; will be empty if no such methods could be found

      • getRawType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getRawType(java.lang.reflect.Type rType)
        Returns the raw type class for a certain reflection Type.
        Parameters:
        rType - The reflection type
        Returns:
        The raw type class for the given type
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given type cannot be mapped to an unambiguous raw type

      • getWrapperType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getWrapperType(java.lang.Class<?> rPrimitiveClass)
        Returns the corresponding wrapper type class (e.g. Integer.class, Character.class) for a certain primitive class (int.class, char.class).
        Parameters:
        rPrimitiveClass - The class to return the corresponding wrapper type for
        Returns:
        The corresponding wrapper type or NULL if the argument is not an instance of a primitive class

      • invoke

        public static java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                                      java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                                      java.lang.Object... rArgs)
        Invokes a particular method on a target object. If the invocation fails an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. If the method or it's class is not public this method will try to make it accessible by invoking AccessibleObject.setAccessible(boolean) on it. This requires that the caller's context has sufficient rights to do so, else a SecurityException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target object to invoke the method on
        rMethod - The method instance to invoke
        rArgs - The arguments of the method call
        Returns:
        The return value of the method call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the invocation fails

      • invokeAny

        public static java.lang.Object invokeAny(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                                         java.lang.String sMethod)
        Invokes any kind of declared no-argument methods on a target object.
        See Also:
        invokeAny(Object, String, Object[], Class[])

      • invokeAny

        public static java.lang.Object invokeAny(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                                         java.lang.String sMethod,
                                         java.lang.Object[] rArgs,
                                         java.lang.Class<?>[] rArgTypes)
        Invokes any kind of declared method on a target object. If the method is not found in the target object itself it's class hierarchy will be searched for it. The actual method invocation is then performed by calling invoke(Object, Method, Object...)
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target object to invoke the method on
        sMethod - The name of the public method to invoke
        rArgs - The arguments of the method call (NULL for none)
        rArgTypes - The classes of the argument types or NULL if they shall be determined from the argument values (only possible if these are not NULL and do not span class hierarchies)
        Returns:
        The return value of the method call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no matching method could be found or if the invocation fails

      • invokeDeclared

        public static java.lang.Object invokeDeclared(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                                              java.lang.String sMethod,
                                              java.lang.Object[] rArgs,
                                              java.lang.Class<?>[] rArgTypes)
        Invokes a declared method on a target object. This requires that the caller's context has sufficient rights to do so if the method is not public.
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target object to invoke the method on
        sMethod - The name of the public method to invoke
        rArgs - The arguments of the method call (NULL for none)
        rArgTypes - The classes of the argument types or NULL if they shall be determined from the argument values (only possible if these are not NULL and do not span class hierarchies)
        Returns:
        The return value of the method call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no matching method could be found or if the invocation fails

      • invokePublic

        public static java.lang.Object invokePublic(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                                            java.lang.String sMethod)
        Invokes a public no-argument method on a target object.
        See Also:
        invokePublic(Object, String, Object[], Class[])

      • invokePublic

        public static java.lang.Object invokePublic(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                                            java.lang.String sMethod,
                                            java.lang.Object[] rArgs,
                                            java.lang.Class<?>[] rArgTypes)
        Invokes a public method on a target object. Uses the method getPublicMethod(Class, String, Object[], Class[]) to determine the corresponding Method instance.
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target object to invoke the method on
        sMethod - The name of the public method to invoke
        rArgs - The arguments of the method call (NULL for none)
        rArgTypes - The classes of the argument types or NULL if they shall be determined from the argument values (only possible if these are not NULL and have the exact types)
        Returns:
        The return value of the method call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no matching method could be found or if the invocation fails

      • invokeStatic

        public static java.lang.Object invokeStatic(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                            java.lang.String sMethod)
        Invokes a public static no-argument method on a target object.
        See Also:
        invokeStatic(Class, String, Object[], Class[])

      • invokeStatic

        public static java.lang.Object invokeStatic(java.lang.Class<?> rClass,
                                            java.lang.String sMethod,
                                            java.lang.Object[] rArgs,
                                            java.lang.Class<?>[] rArgTypes)
        Invokes a public static method on a target class. Uses the method getPublicMethod(Class, String, Object[], Class[]) to determine the corresponding Method instance.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The target class to invoke the static method on
        sMethod - The name of the public method to invoke
        rArgs - The arguments of the method call (NULL for none)
        rArgTypes - The classes of the argument types or NULL if they shall be determined from the argument values (only possible if these are not NULL and have the exact types)
        Returns:
        The return value of the method call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no matching method could be found or if the invocation fails

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(java.lang.Class<T> rClass)
        A convenience method to invoke Class.newInstance() without the need for explicit exception handling.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to invoke the no-argument constructor of
        Returns:
        A new instance of the given class
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the instantiation fails

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(java.lang.reflect.Constructor<T> rConstructor,
                                java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
        Creates a new instance by invoking a public constructor with a certain number of arguments. If the invocation fails an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown, initialized with the causing exception.
        Parameters:
        rConstructor - The constructor to invoke
        rArgs - The arguments of the call (NULL for none)
        Returns:
        The new instance created by the constructor
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the invocation fails

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(java.lang.Class<T> rClass,
                                java.lang.Object[] rArgs,
                                java.lang.Class<?>[] rArgTypes)
        Creates a new instance by invoking a public constructor of a target class.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The target class to invoke the constructor of
        rArgs - The arguments of the constructor call (NULL for none)
        rArgTypes - The classes of the argument types or NULL if they shall be determined from the argument values (only possible if these are not NULL and do not span class hierarchies)
        Returns:
        The new instance created by the constructor
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no matching constructor could be found or if the invocation fails

      • registerImplementation

        public static <I> void registerImplementation(java.lang.Class<I> rInterface,
                                              java.lang.Class<? extends I> rImplementation)
        Registers an interface implementation class. Registered implementations can then be queried with getImplementationClass(Class). Some implementations are registered automatically, e.g. for the Java collection framework. Applications can register their own mappings to allow the easy reflective creation of instances for which only the interface type is known.
        Parameters:
        rInterface - The interface class
        rImplementation - The implementation class to be associated with the interface
